<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n6xdvdrCs61rr2wit.jpg"/><a href="http://bit.ly/1oOupMo"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/e4aef745bfbdfeaa52153580f9a71fa3/tumblr_inline_n6xe0nt07G1rr2wit.png"/></a></p>

<p><strong>joed_</strong>'s <a href="http://bit.ly/1oOupMo"><strong>Kerbal Crew Transfer</strong></a> makes the transfer of crew members between modules as easy as space pie. It’s also made to be lightweight and has preliminary support for Connected Living Spaces</p>

<p>Click <a href="http://bit.ly/TBV5Gx"><strong>HERE</strong></a> for more about <strong>Kerbal Crew Transfer</strong>.</p>

I haven't tried this mod out myself, but an excellent alternative would be Kerbal Crew Manifest, which can also be used to add/remove Kerbals from the craft while on launchpad or runway, and it even has a nice GUI to make it easier. It also won't clutter the part windows if you have many Kerbals in a single pod, from one of the many habitat mods for example.

The right-click-menus only working good if you have not that much crew or just small structures. Using this method with large structures and/or a lot of crew is a pain. So I like more ship manifest, because more handy, better overview and no cam angle acrobatics.

Yet for a fast simple crew transfer this mod looks much more handy.

True, to reorganize the crew of a big ship docked to a large space station Ship Manifest is the mod to go to, but to just move 1-3 Kerbals from a lander back to the transfer module, this mod is easier than opening and navigating windows and than closing them again.

Oh neat. I've always loved crew manifest, but this looks interesting as well. I can think of some areas where I may still prefer to use crew manifest though. Namely creating new custom kerbals as well as needing to transfer crew at launch, when trying to get the camera to cooperate in order to select ships may be difficult (Yeah, I could just go back to the VAB and set them there, but...). But the idea of being able to transfer crew using the alt-click menus is a nice one.

Actually, this is the first time I saw anything about the Connected Living Spaces mod, which looks interesting and might be one I check out as well.
